ovdesc.p: The CLOSURE property class is used to Close an AA account if no more transactions happen in that account.In case of non-revolving arrangements, once all balances are settled, Arrangement account Closure can be triggered anytime manually or automatically. For revolving arrangements, the activity can be triggered on or after maturity. On reversal of a new arrangement, account closure would be triggered automatically.

Defines named values to indicate if an option applies to the associated NR.ATTRIBUTE. More than one option can be associated with the NR.ATTRIBUTE, with certain restrictions.
Valid Inputs are NEGOTIABLE, NON-NEGOTIABLE, OVERRIDE, FIX-VALUE, MANDATORY as described below: -
NEGOTIABLE
The value of NEGOTIABLE will indicate that the associated NR.ATTRIBUTE can be negotiated at the arrangement level.
NON-NEGOTIABLE
The value of NON-NEGOTIABLE will indicate that the associated NR.ATTRIBUTE cannot be negotiated at the arrangement level. Both NEGOTIABLE and NON-NEGOTIABLE cannot be defined together
OVERRIDE
Specifies if a default override message should be generated if the default attribute is amended at the arrangement level. If OVERRIDE is not specified, no override will be generated.
FIX-VALUE
Specified if the field value is to be fixed at the arrangement level. If FIX-VALUE is not specified the field value will vary with the changes to the underlying product condition.
MANDATORY
Specifies if the attribute is mandatory for this product condition. Can only be specified where the attribute is not defined as mandatory in the property class.

This field defines whether the arrangement account would get closed automatically or would be closed manually.
Allowed Values are MANUAL and AUTOMATIC
MANUAL - closure activity can be triggered manually when all balances get settled.
AUTOMATIC - close activity will be triggered on the day in which the activity has been scheduled in AA.SCHEDULED.ACTIVITY.

This field specifies the period after which closure activity needs to be scheduled once the arrangement account is identified for closure. (Based on closure Method and Closure type settings). This field will not be considered if close activity is triggered manually. (Eg., If CLOSURE.PERIOD is 10 Days, Closure activity would be scheduled 10 days after the balances are settled or after maturity date depending on the CLOSURE.TYPE.)
If CLOSURE.PERIOD is NULL , Close activity would be scheduled on the date in which all balances are settled.
Validation rule:
Valid PERIOD field.
Maximum of 4 characters
This field defines when the Closure Activity should be triggered.
Allowed values are MATURITY, BALANCE , NULL
MATURITY - Closure activity would be scheduled on or after maturity date based on CLOSURE PERIOD provided all balances are settled.
BALANCE - Closure activity would be scheduled once all balances in the arrangement become Zero.
NULL - If Closure Method is "Manual" , then CLOSURE.TYPE should be NULL.
Optional field - Allowed Values are RESETTING and NON-RESETTING.
RESETTING - During any Renewal Activities (for eg : change.product, rollover or reset) the property conditions will be reset from the product.
NON-RESETTING - During any Renewal Activities property conditions will be maintained from the Arrangement level.
Leaving the field blank sets NON-RESETTING as the default option.
